{"id":798061403,"lang":"python","lang_name":"Python","time":"1 month, 4 weeks","timestamp":1662999816,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"101 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/798061403/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"13.6 MB","code":"# Definition for singly-linked list.\n# class ListNode(object):\n#     def __init__(self, val=0, next=None):\n#         self.val = val\n#         self.next = next\nclass Solution(object):\n    def addTwoNumbers(self, l1, l2):\n        \"\"\"\n        :type l1: ListNode\n        :type l2: ListNode\n        :rtype: ListNode\n        \"\"\"\n        node1 = l1\n        node2 = l2\n        sum1 = 0\n        sum2 = 0\n        i = 1\n        while node1 is not None or node2 is not None:\n            if node1 is not None:\n                sum1 += node1.val * i\n                node1 = node1.next\n            if node2 is not None:\n                sum2 += node2.val * i\n                node2 = node2.next\n            \n            \n            i = i*10\n        sum = sum1 + sum2\n        \n        number = sum % 10\n        sum = sum / 10\n        sumNode = ListNode(number)\n        rList = sumNode\n        while sum != 0:\n            number = sum % 10\n            sum = sum /10\n            sumNode.next = ListNode(number)\n            sumNode = sumNode.next\n        return rList\n            \n            \n            \n            \n            ","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers","has_notes":false,"notes":"","topic_tags":[]}
